title: PANTERA Has Never Played These Eight Songs Live
description: But they really should. The post PANTERA Has Never Played These Eight Songs Live appeared first on Metal Injection.
author: Greg Kennelty
byline: By Greg Kennelty Published 6 hours ago
text: Pantera's legacy is built on a foundation of crushing riffs, explosive energy, and unforgettable live performances. From packed clubs to massive arenas, the band earned their reputation by delivering intense shows that left fans in awe. But even with their extensive touring history and deep catalog of heavy-hitting tracks, not every song made it to the stage. Whether due to timing, musical direction, or simply being overlooked, some Pantera songs have never been performed live. This list compiles those elusive tracks, partially in hopes that Pantera sees it and says "you know? 'Clash With Reality' is a sick song. We should play that." Sorry, Phil. "Medicine Man" – Cowboys From Hell (1990) "Clash With Reality" – Cowboys From Hell (1990) "Suicide Note Pt. I" – The Great Southern Trendkill (1996) "The Underground in America" – The Great Southern Trendkill (1996) "Where You Come From" – Official Live: 101 Proof (1997) "Avoid the Light" – Dracula 2000 (2000) "Immortally Insane" – The Texas Chainsaw Massacre Soundtrack (2003) "Piss" – Vulgar Display of Power 20th Anniversary Reissue (2012) Want More Metal? html:
Pantera's legacy is built on a foundation of crushing riffs, explosive energy, and unforgettable live performances. From packed clubs to massive arenas, the band earned their reputation by delivering intense shows that left fans in awe. But even with their extensive touring history and deep catalog of heavy-hitting tracks, not every song made it to the stage.

Whether due to timing, musical direction, or simply being overlooked, some Pantera songs have never been performed live. This list compiles those elusive tracks, partially in hopes that Pantera sees it and says "you know? 'Clash With Reality' is a sick song. We should play that." Sorry, Phil.

"Medicine Man" – Cowboys From Hell (1990)

"Clash With Reality" – Cowboys From Hell (1990)

"Suicide Note Pt. I" – The Great Southern Trendkill (1996)

"The Underground in America" – The Great Southern Trendkill (1996)

"Where You Come From" – Official Live: 101 Proof (1997)

"Avoid the Light" – Dracula 2000 (2000)

"Immortally Insane" – The Texas Chainsaw Massacre Soundtrack (2003)

"Piss" – Vulgar Display of Power 20th Anniversary Reissue (2012)
